connector.description: Map between Java beans using the Dozer mapping library.

camel.sink.path.name.name: camel.sink.path.name
camel.sink.path.name.description: A human readable name of the mapping.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.mappingConfiguration.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mappingConfiguration
camel.sink.endpoint.mappingConfiguration.description: The name of a DozerBeanMapperConfiguration bean in the Camel registry which should be used for configuring the Dozer mapping. This is an alternative to the mappingFile option that can be used for fine-grained control over how Dozer is configured. Remember to use a # prefix in the value to indicate that the bean is in the Camel registry (e.g. #myDozerConfig).

camel.sink.endpoint.mappingFile.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mappingFile
camel.sink.endpoint.mappingFile.description: The location of a Dozer configuration file. The file is loaded from the classpath by default, but you can use file:, classpath:, or http: to load the configuration from a specific location.

camel.sink.endpoint.marshalId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.marshalId
camel.sink.endpoint.marshalId.description: The id of a dataFormat defined within the Camel Context to use for marshalling the mapping output to a non-Java type.

camel.sink.endpoint.sourceModel.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sourceModel
camel.sink.endpoint.sourceModel.description: Fully-qualified class name for the source type used in the mapping. If specified, the input to the mapping is converted to the specified type before being mapped with Dozer.

camel.sink.endpoint.targetModel.name: camel.sink.endpoint.targetModel
camel.sink.endpoint.targetModel.description: Fully-qualified class name for the target type used in the mapping.

camel.sink.endpoint.unmarshalId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.unmarshalId
camel.sink.endpoint.unmarshalId.description: The id of a dataFormat defined within the Camel Context to use for unmarshalling the mapping input from a non-Java type.

camel.component.dozer.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.dozer.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.dozer.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.dozer.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.dozer.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.dozer.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
